claim: The heart is located in the right side of the chest

supporting.text: Anatomical studies and medical textbooks consistently describe the heart as being located in the left side of the chest, behind the sternum and between the lungs.

attacks.text: Anatomical studies and medical textbooks consistently describe the heart as being located in the left side of the chest, behind the sternum and between the lungs.
In rare cases of situs inversus, a congenital condition, the heart is located on the right side of the chest.
Situs inversus affects only about 1 in 10,000 people, making it statistically insignificant for general anatomical descriptions.
